NDSH
Table of Contents

Interface IStandardObjectProperties

Namespace
NDSH.Geospatial.Gml
Assembly
NDSH.Geospatial.Metadata.ISO19115.Ed2003.dll

Defines the standard set of properties that can be associated with a GML object.

public interface IStandardObjectProperties

Remarks

This interface encapsulates the common properties defined within the gml:StandardObjectProperties group, which includes metadata properties, descriptions, identifiers, and names. These properties provide essential information about a GML object, including textual descriptions, references to external descriptions, and authoritative identifiers.
The metadata properties allow linking to ISO 19115-compliant metadata, and names and identifiers facilitate object identification and classification.
This interface is based on the GML 3.2 specification and aligns with the ISO 19115 metadata standard.

Properties

Description

Gets/Sets the text description of the object.

[Obsolete("Marked 'deprecated' in /gml/gmlBase.xsd")]
StringOrRefType? Description { get; set; }

Property Value

StringOrRefType

Remarks

gml:description uses gml:StringOrRefType as its content model, so it may contain a simple text string content, or carry a reference to an external description. The use of gml:description to reference an external description has been deprecated and replaced by the gml:descriptionReference property.

DescriptionReference

Gets/Sets the remote text description of the object.

ReferenceType? DescriptionReference { get; set; }

Property Value

ReferenceType

Remarks

The xlink:href attribute of the gml:descriptionReference property references the external description.

Identifier

Gets/Sets the label or identifier for the object, commonly a descriptive name.

CodeWithAuthorityType? Identifier { get; set; }

Property Value

CodeWithAuthorityType

Remarks

An object may have several names, typically assigned by different authorities. gml:name uses the gml:CodeType content model. The authority for a name is indicated by the value of its (optional) codeSpace attribute. The name may or may not be unique, as determined by the rules of the organization responsible for the codeSpace. In common usage there will be one name per authority, so a processing application may select the name from its preferred codeSpace.

MetaDataProperty

Gets/Sets the collection of metadata properties associated with the object.

ObservableCollection<MetaDataPropertyType>? MetaDataProperty { get; set; }

Property Value

ObservableCollection<MetaDataPropertyType>

Remarks

The metaDataProperty element is used to link metadata to a GML object. It follows the MetaDataPropertyType content model, which allows for association with metadata described by any XML Schema. This property does not inherently imply ownership of the metadata, but ownership can be asserted using the IOwnership.

Name

Gets/Sets the special identifier that is often assigned to an object by the maintaining authority with the intention that it is used in references to the object. For such cases, the codeSpace shall be provided. That identifier is usually unique either globally or within an application domain. gml:identifier is a pre-defined property for such identifiers.

ObservableCollection<CodeType>? Name { get; set; }

Property Value

ObservableCollection<CodeType>
